intro: Campylandra, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a genus of flowering plants in the mallow family, Malvaceae. It is native to Australia and consists of several species, many of which are shrubs or small trees. The plants are characterized by their showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. They typically grow in rocky or sandy soils and are adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. The leaves are often palmately lobed, and the flowers bloom during the spring and summer months.
